intro: Savastana mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican savastana, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Savastana mexicana is adapted to survive in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments.
